body: Thank you for reporting this. Which version is this verified with?
I was originally using 2.10.1, but I just tested this on 2.11.0 and it's still occurring.

issue.title: Support for missing values (non-compliant JSON)

repository.name: jackson-core
repository.description: Core part of Jackson that defines Streaming API as well as basic shared abstractions

body: One quick note: commas should not really be accepted as separators in root level so just realizing that this needs to result in parsing error. But bit worried that someone somewhere might already be relying on such behavior...

rename.from: Parsing JSON with ALLOW_MISSING_VALUE enabled results in infinite loop on top-level commas
rename.to: Parsing JSON with `ALLOW_MISSING_VALUE` enabled results in endless stream of `VALUE_NULL` tokens

body: Fixed: will now report parsing error for root-level commas, which will also prevent infinite sequences of `VALUE_NULL`s. Fix will be in 2.10.5.

issue.title: GH-2192 upgrade jsonld-java and jackson + fix for test

repository.name: rdf4j
repository.description: Eclipse RDF4J: scalable RDF for Java

issue.body:
GitHub issue resolved: #2192 <!-- add a Github issue number here, e.g #123. -->

Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

* updated jackson dependencies
* updated json-ld java
* small change in test
* include newer snake YAML dependency for ES compliance test

issue.title: GH-2553 upgrade jackson dependency

repository.name: rdf4j

issue.body:
Signed-off-by: Bart Hanssens <bart.hanssens@bosa.fgov.be>


GitHub issue resolved: #2553  <!-- add a Github issue number here, e.g #123. -->

Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

Upgrade to 2.10.5, since it may fix a JSON  issue in rare circumstances (https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-core/issues/616)

Note: we merge all feature pull requests using [squash and merge](https://help.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/about-merge-methods-on-github#squashing-your-merge-commits). See [RDF4J git merge strategy](https://rdf4j.org/documentation/developer/merge-strategy/) for more details.
